general_advisory: Regular monitoring of the crop for incidence of pest and diseases should be done & keep your crop field free from weed. Apply balanced and appropriate fertilizers according to cropâ€™s growth stage followed by irrigation.

advisory: Weed Management: Apply granular herbicide Bensulfuron-methyl + Pretilachlor @ 4 kg/acre at 5-8 days after transplanting by mixing with equal quantity of sand and broadcast it uniformly in the field or spray Pyrazosulfuron-ethyl 10 WP @ 5 g/10 ltrs of water at 3-5 days after transplanting or spray Bispyribac sodium @ 8 ml by mixing with 10 liters of water at 10-15 DAT.

Nutrient Management: In direct seeded rice apply urea @ 24 kg/acre as fist top dressing at 20-25 DAS. Prepare the main field for timely transplanting. Apply DAP 44 kg + MOP 22 kg per acre as basal dose during final puddling.

Disease and Insect Management: If infestation of blast disease is noticed in direct seeded rice, spray Carbendazim 50 WP @ 1g/ltr of water or Trifloxystrobin 25% + Tebuconazole 50% @ 4 g/10 ltrs of water or Edifenphos 50 EC @ 1 ml/ltr of water. In bacterial blight endemic areas, dip the seedling roots in 0.1% Plantomycin solution before transplanting for 30 minutes. Install 3 pheromone traps with 5mg lure/acre in the rice field for monitoring of the yellow stem borer and leaf folder just after the transplanting. Whenever the number of male moths/trap reaches 4 or 5, spray Azadiractin 0.15% neem seed kernel-based EC formulation @ 4 ml/ltr of water or apply Cartap hydrochloride 4G @ 10 kg/acre mixing with sand at 1:1 ratio.
Water management: Now the crop is at the flowering stage. So flowering and grain filling stages are critical for green and black gram and water stress must be avoided during this period.

Disease and Insect Management: Yellow Mosaic Virus/Jassids/Aphid/Thrips: If infection of YMV is noticed, then infected plants should be uprooted and buried in the soil. Installation of yellow sticky trap @ 8/acre to control sucking pests complex and blue sticky trap @ 8/acre for monitoring thrips at the vegetative stage is recommended. Spray Thiomethoxam 25 WG @ 1g/5 ltr or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 1.5 ml/5 ltr of water to control by chemical method. Powdery mildew: Spray Carbendazim 50% WP @1g/ltr or Penconazole 10% EC @ 0.5ml/ltr of water.
Similar advisory as green gram regarding water management and disease and insect management.
Similar advisory as green gram regarding water management and disease and insect management.

Disease & Insect Management: For further information, contact the IMD, Bhubaneswar, Tel. #0674-2596116. Aphid/Jassids/White fly/Thrips: Install yellow sticky trap @ 8/acre to monitor sucking pests complex and blue sticky trap @ 8/acre for monitoring thrips at the vegetative stage. Tobacco Caterpillar: To monitor effectively install pheromone trap (Spodolure) @ 8 no./ac at vegetative stage and replace the lure after 3 weeks.

Weed Management: Apply Tembotrione 34.4% SC @ 6ml or Topramezone 33.6% SC @ 1.5 g by mixing with 10 liters of water at 20-25 DAS for chemical control. Nutrient Management: Apply 75 kg urea as the first top dressing at 20-25 DAS and 45 kg Urea + 20 kg MOP as the second top dressing at 40-45 DAS. Insect Management: Aphid & Thrips: Spray Thiomethoxam 25 WG @ 1g/5 ltr or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 1.5 ml/5 ltr of water. Stem Borer: For effective control of stem borer spray Fipronil 5% SC or Profenophos 50% EC @ 2ml/ltr of water. FAW: Apply Emamectin Benzoate 5% SG @ 2 ml/5 ltr of water to control FAW infestation.
Similar advisory as cauliflower and cabbage regarding disease and insect management.

Disease and Insect Management: Dimond back moth: Spray Fipronil 5% SC @ 2ml/ltr or Chlorpyriphos 20% EC @ 4ml/ltr of water. Tobacco leaf eating caterpillar: Spray Cyantraniliprole 10.26% OD @ 6ml/5 ltr of water. Cabbage Aphid: Spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 2g/5ltr of water.
Similar advisory as cauliflower regarding disease and insect management.

Disease and Insect Management: Thrips: To manage thrips infestation install Blue sticky trap @ 8 nos./acre. For chemical control spray Emamectin Benzoate 5% SG @ 2 g or Fipronil 5% SC @ 10 ml or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL 1.5 ml by mixing with 5 ltrs of water. Anthracnose: To control anthracnose disease spray Azoxystrobin 8.3% + Mancozeb 66.7% WG @ 3 g/lit or Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG @ 0.5 g/lit of water.

Insect Management: Fruit and Shoot borer: Install pheromone trap/Wata trap @ 8 nos. per acre area at vegetative stage and replace lure after 3 weeks. To control chemically, spray Spinosad 45% SC @ 5.5 ml by mixing with 15 liters of water or Thiodicarb 75% WP @ 2ml/ltr of water. White fly: Install yellow sticky trap @ 8-10/acre or spray Neem Based Pesticide (Azadirachtin) 1500 PPM @ 3ml/ltr of water at the initial stage of infestation.
Disease Management: Purple blotch: Spray Difenoconazole 25% EC or Tebuconazole 25.9% EC or Kitazin 48% EC @ 1g/ltr of water.
